sentences.english: This is a sentence or string phrase that has been encrypted.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個被加密的句子或字符串短語。

sentences.english: A Wang is looking for you.
sentences.chinese: 一位姓王的同介詞短語志正在找你。

sentences.english: Use each of the above italicized phrases in sentences of your own.
sentences.chinese: 用以上斜體印出的短語各造一個句子。

sentences.english: One important syntactic function of preposition phrases is to be the adverbial before subject.
sentences.chinese: 作句首狀語是部分介詞短語的重要句法功能。

sentences.english: Determiners are used at the beginning of noun groups.
sentences.chinese: 限定詞用於名詞短語前面。

sentences.english: What are some of the most commonly used phrasal verbs?
sentences.chinese: 那麼有哪些是較爲常用的短語動詞表達呢？

sentences.english: Provide an interlinear translation of a word or phrase.
sentences.chinese: 在行與行之間爲詞或短語作解釋。

sentences.english: DP hypothesis concerns with determiner phrases.
sentences.chinese: DP假說是關於限定詞短語的假說。

sentences.english: Head: the word around which a phrase is formed is termed head.
sentences.chinese: 短語構成所圍繞的詞叫中心詞。

sentences.english: The word order of the attribute-head phrase is the biggest difference between the word order in Chinese and Vietnamese.
sentences.chinese: 定中短語是漢語和越語中最常見的語法結構之一。

sentences.english: Avoid extra words and qualifying phrases.
sentences.chinese: 不要用多餘詞彙和限制性短語。

sentences.english: British Prime Minister Benjamin Disraeli is believed to have been the first to use the phrase.
sentences.chinese: 英國首相迪斯雷利被認爲是被首先使用的短語。

sentences.english: Sometimes people use poker faces when negotiating a business deal.
sentences.chinese: 有時人們也將撲克臉這個短語應用於商務談判。

sentences.english: It is important to recognize the prosodic phrase breaks in text-to-speech.
sentences.chinese: 句子的韻律短語識別是語音合成的重要研究內容。

sentences.english: I am not interested in mastering a few phrases or simple greetings.
sentences.chinese: 我對掌握一些短語或者簡單的問候語不感興趣。

sentences.english: I have always been intrigued about the phrases “falling in love” and “falling head over heels” in love.
sentences.chinese: 我一直好奇“墜入愛河”和“墮入情網”等相關短語。

definition: to bring out the main theme/to make the point/to bring out the substance concisely
proposition (logic, math.)/to assign an essay topic
